Dear Gerry Cunningham,

 Every MP in Westminster was given a mandate and elected to be their constituency's representative. We don't elect a Prime Minister. We elect Her Majesty's Government by sending the party we like with the most MPs to the the Mother of All Parliaments. Let's see if the SNP are fit for purpose: the SNP an anti-austerity party when given sweeping new tax powers choose to keep austerity and still somehow only increase the deficit, whilst the First Minister accepts a salary much higher than the Prime Minister's and campaigns in an expensive  helicopter. They talk about independence, but want the state to interfere in the private life of families. They talk about education, but do worse than anyone else in the Union and then blame it on Westminster and Scottish Labour, whilst capping university places and leaving students in debt after promising not to. They are "Progressive", but their policies favour the rich non-nationalisation etc. and they team up with the Conservatives over Labour or the Greens any day.  They talk about refugees incessantly, but take next to none and believe in the strongest borders possible with the UK nation that takes the most. They only want devolution, but vote on English matters "if they think it will affect Scotland". Their youngest ever MP who they held up as a beacon to younger generations is a terrible MP who doesn't take part in debates and then flies business class back and forth to Westminster at taxpayer's expense. They are "a party who believes in equality", but Tasmina Ahmed Sheikh, whilst the minister for Women and Equality politely didn't do the same, interrupted a talk on Men's Rights Day about high suicide in males and what can be done, by filibustering and talking about female rights instead for as long as she possibly could until the time was gone, whilst simultaneously in interviews expressing utter shock that a male would dare interrupt her when it was his turn to speak.  They lampoon MPs for not saying LGBT(I), but their second biggest donor is a billionaire homophobe, Brian Souter, who affected other areas of policy too (not progressive if we give you money, eh?). After he gave £500k, the SNP opposed homosexuality and dropped a commitment (made at the party's 2006 conference) to re-regulate the bus network (where Brain Souter made his money) from their 2007 manifesto, They claim to be pro-EU when their oldest members often wanted to leave the EU. They purport to be democratic, but want another referendum till they win.  I put it to you that they are only fit for purpose if that purpose is to blame everything on Westminster and think in an idiotic Utopian way that independence will fix everything. They are fit for the purpose of believing in Scotland the nation at the expense of the Scottish people.
